subject: Leadership
title: The Art of Persuasion
description: Learn The Art of Persuasion in one minute.

hook.text: Aristotle identified three pillars of persuasion 2,300 years ago. They still work in every boardroom today.

buildup.text: Ethos is credibility, pathos is emotion, logos is logic. Great persuaders weave all three into every argument.

discovery.text: Research shows people decide emotionally first, then justify with logic. Leading with data alone rarely changes minds.

twist.text: The most persuasive leaders don't argue louder. They listen first, then frame their case in the other person's terms.

climax.text: Persuasion isn't manipulation. It's helping others see why your idea serves their interests too.

punchline.text: Win the heart first. The mind will follow.

quiz.question: What are Aristotle's three pillars of persuasion?
